member.summary: Gets factories for the objects that the supported formatters will serialize as samples. Processed in order, stopping when the factory successfully returns a non- object.

member.summary: This class will create an object of a given type and populate it with sample data.

member.name: M:Cloud_Services_Api.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.name: T:Cloud_Services_Api.Controllers.BaseController
member.summary: Abstract controller that all other controllers in the API will inherit from. This controller will contain common methods that are used across all API controllers.

member.name: M:Cloud_Services_Api.Controllers.BaseController.InitEngine
member.summary: Method to create and initialize the LEAD OCR engine.

member.name: M:Cloud_Services_Api.Controllers.BaseController.AuthenticateRequest
member.summary: Method to authenticate any request made to the service. For the purposes of this demo, no authentication information is checked. There is generic code for conforming to the HTTP Basic Authentication standard.

member.name: M:Cloud_Services_Api.Controllers.BaseController.VerifyCommonParameters(Cloud_Services_Api.Helper.LeadWebRequest)
member.summary: Method to verify the common parameters that are sent with every request to the service. This method also double checks to make sure that the LEADTOOLS license is set appropriately.

member.name: M:Cloud_Services_Api.Controllers.BaseController.GenerateExceptionMessage(System.Exception)
member.summary: Method to parse an exception, and return an appropriate HTTP response and message.

member.name: M:Cloud_Services_Api.Controllers.BaseController.GetImageStream(System.String)
member.summary: Method to extract file data sent by a request. This method will prioritize a file passed via the fileUrl request parameter over a file passed as multi-part content.

member.summary: Method to determine whether or not a URL is valid.

member.summary: Method to ensure that a files that is sent to the service is valid

member.summary: Download stream from a URI

member.summary: Write a stream to disk

member.summary: Service call to convert a file to any Raster-based LEADTOOLS supported format.
member.returns: Body content of the response will contain a list of URLS.

member.summary: Controller to handle any recognition requests that are made to the services.

member.summary: Method to extract barcode information from a file

member.summary: Service call to extract every barcode from a file.

member.summary: This method is used by the ExtractText/ExtractTextAdditional API methods in order to extract textual information from a file.

member.name: M:Cloud_Services_Api.Controllers.RecognitionController.ExtractText(Cloud_Services_Api.Helper.ExtractTextWebRequest)
member.summary: Service call to extract all text from a file.
member.returns: Body content of the response will contain a list of Text Results from a file. Will pull all the text and words from a file.

member.summary: Service call to extract all check information from a file.
member.returns: Body content of the response will contain a list of all MICR information in a file.

member.summary: Web Request for extracting Barcode information

member.name: P:Cloud_Services_Api.Helper.BarcodeWebRequest.symbologies
member.summary: A comma separated string of symbologies corresponding where each entry in the string corresponds to the LEADTOOLS BarcodeSymbology Enum. For the full list of supported Barcode Symbologies, reference our documentation here: https://www.leadtools.com/help/leadtools/v20/dh/ba/barcodesymbology.html
